蛧蛧蛧

蛧字的基本解释

蛧
wǎng
古同“魍”。

蛧字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wǎng］
［《集韻》文紡切，上養，微。］
亦作“蛧1”。
见“蝄蜽”。

蛧字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蛧； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1082第20
【唐韻】文兩切【集韻】文紡切，?音網。【說文】蛧蜽也。【淮南王說蛧蜽】狀如三歲小兒，赤黑色，赤目，長耳，美髮。【魯語】木石之怪曰夔蛧蜽。【註】蛧蜽，山精，好斆人聲而迷惑人也。【張衡·南都賦】追水豹兮鞭蛧蜽。【註】蛧蜽，山川之精物也。　【韻會】蛧蜽，《周禮》作方良，《史記·孔子世家》作?閬，《左傳》作㒺兩。【六書正譌】別作䰣魎。

蛧字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
蛧字的起名意思

暂无。

Scorpion
Basic explanation of words
Scorpion
wǎng
The ancient same "sprite".
Scorpion
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wǎng］
["Ji Yun" Wen spinning cut, upper raising, micro. ]
Also known as "蛧1".
See "Small worm".
Scorpion
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　蛧; Kangxi Strokes: 12; Page Number: Page 1082 Page 20
[Tang Yun] Two-cut Wen [Ji Yun] Wen-spun cut,? Yinnet. [Said the text] 蛧蜽 also. [The King of Huainan said that worms] looked like a three-year-old child, red-black, red eyes, long ears, and hairdressing. [Lu language] The strangeness of wood and stone is called Kui Zhe. [Note] The worms, the mountain spirits, are so sweet and confusing. [Zhang Heng·Nandu Fu] Chasing water leopard and whip and whip. [Note] The chrysalis, the essence of mountains and rivers.　【Yunhui】Zhuzhu, "Zhou Li" as Fang Liang, "Historical Records·Confucius Family" as "Lang", "Zuo Zhuan" as 㒺liang. 【Liushu Zhengzheng】Don't be a ghost.
